title: Analyzing the Impact of Standardization and Accreditation Processes on Academic Freedom and Learning Quality: A Self-Determination Theory-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Explores the correlation between standardized processes in higher education and academic freedom through empirical analysis using VR simulations for current practitioners, applying interactive learning modules in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze the impact of higher education standardization processes on academic freedom using a self-determination theory framework

Learners Can Analyze the Impact of Certification Procedures on the Quality of Science Laboratory Learning Across Three Dimensions (Efficiency, Error Reduction, Immersion) Using VR Simulation Tools (e.g., Labster, Engage) and Write Evaluation Reports Based on a 5-Point Likert Scale
Learners can propose flexible certification policy improvements applicable to vocational training institutions based on research findings
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
